Name Rascal/Libraries/IO/print

Function bool print(value V...)
Description Print a list of values on the output stream and always return true.
Examples Note that the only difference with println is that true is returned instead of void: 
rascal>import IO;
ok
rascal>print("Hello World");
Hello Worldok
Introduce to variable and print their values: 
rascal>S = "Hello World";
str: "Hello World"
rascal>L = ["a", "b", "c"];
list[str]: ["a","b","c"]
rascal>print(S, L);
Static Error: prompt:///:1,0: The called signature: print(str, list[str]),
does not match the declared signature:    print(value)
Benefits This function is handy when debugging complicated expressions.
[Edit] | [New] | [Compile Course] | [Warnings]
